body:
@steveklabnik, @rafaelfranca please have a look. I noticed that there are more internal variables. Should they be prefixed too? I don't think we should try to minimize naming conflicts as much as possible. The current list is:

```ruby
      INTERNAL_IVARS = [
        :@__name__,
        :@__io__,
        :@_assertion_wrapped,
        :@_assertions,
        :@_result,
        :@_routes,
        :@controller,
        :@_layouts,
        :@locals,
        :@method_name,
        :@output_buffer,
        :@_partials,
        :@passed,
        :@rendered,
        :@request,
        :@routes,
        :@tagged_logger,
        :@_templates,
        :@options,
        :@test_passed,
        :@view,
        :@view_context_class
      ]
```
